description: Borrowed from Middle French portable, or from Latin portabilis.

adjectives.description: portable (comparative more portable, superlative most portable)

entries.meaning: Able to be carried or easily moved.
Able to be transferred from one organization to another.
(computing) Of software: able to be run on multiple hardware or operating systems.
examples: How do Java and C# create cross-platform, portable programs, and why can't C++ do the same?

entries.meaning: (computing) Of a program: able to be copied directly from one machine to another without the use of an installer.

definitionGroups.group: A portable building used for temporary purposes, particularly:

entries.meaning: A trailer or other movable structure used for classes at a school.

examples: A few portables, particularly the small laphelds, go one step further and come with software built into the computer.

entries.meaning: (video games) A hand-held video gaming device.
